dataset.name: Wound assessment and treatment
dataset.description: The wound assessment and treatment domain is the major development of the standard, the design of this domain supports the use of assessment frameworks such as SINBAD, TIME etc. There are some notable differences between the three wound types, these are identified here by wound type specific data concepts

concept.name: Risks
concept.implamentationGuidance:
Risk factors for delayed healing: Including diseases and conditions that affect wound healing (e.g. diabetes, auto-immune conditions), systemic and local blood supply to the wound, susceptibility to infection, medication affecting wound healing, skin integrity and other factors that affect healing such as obesity.

Risks to the healing process - pressure, ischaemia, infection, concordance, mobility, nutrition

  • Vascular (Ischaemia; venous insufficiency), ​

  • lymphoedema, ​

  • Infection (IDSA - none, mild, moderate, severe infection), ​

  • Neuropathy, ​

  • Pressure - dynamic or static (PURPOSE-T for static, dynamic = walking/ movement causing pressure), ​

  • Dermatology concerns, ​

  • Acute infection of leg or foot (e.g. increasing unilateral redness, swelling, pain, pus, heat).​

  • Symptoms of sepsis​

  • Acute or chronic limb threatening ischaemia (e.g., PAD with rest pain, gangrene,)​

  • Suspected acute deep vein thrombosis (DVT).​

  • Suspected skin cancer.​

  • Bleeding varicose veins​

  • Charcot​

  • Skin tear​

  • Laceration​

  • Haemorrhage / Catastrophic dehiscence​

  • ‘burst abdomen’ with visible internal organs.​

  • Systemic signs of infection/sepsis.​

  • Follow NICE Guideline for Sepsis: Recognition, Diagnosis and Early Management​

  • Spreading cellulitis, or​

  • Dehiscence if:​

  • Surgery involved implants (e.g. mesh, prosthesis).​

  • Aesthetically or functionally important surgical site (e.g. face or joints).​

  • Dehiscence exposing subcutaneous layers and fascia.​

  • Suspected sinus / fistula / tunnelling.​

  • Stoma within wound boundaries.
concept.description: Details of any risks related to the person.

concept.name: Risks record entry
concept.implamentationGuidance: Risk factors for delayed healing: Including diseases and conditions that affect wound healing (e.g. diabetes, auto-immune conditions), systemic and local blood supply to the wound, susceptibility to infection, medication affecting wound healing, skin integrity and other factors that affect healing such as obesity. Risks to the healing process - pressure, ischaemia, infection, concordance, mobility, nutrition
concept.description: This is a risks record entry. There may be 0 to many record entry/entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.description: The start date of the risk.

concept.name: End date of risk
concept.description: The date the risk ended.

concept.name: Risk
concept.description: The risk to the person or others, this includes any risk the person might cause to themselves or to others. e.g. suicide, self harm.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.implamentationGuidance: A risk that compromises healing
concept.description: The coded value for risk.

concept.name: Wound assessment and treatment
concept.implamentationGuidance: This section contains the assessments, observations and treatments that the health care professional makes about wounds
concept.description:
Top level concept that contains the wound specific concepts covering

  • baseline information,

  • treatment,

  • assessment

  • observation

concept.name: Baseline information
concept.implamentationGuidance: The baseline section contains details of the initial state of the wound, there could be more than one wound being treated and therefore there will be a baseline for each wound, the baseline information would be accompanied by a formal structured assessment (see below) which will be flagged as the initial (primary) assessment
concept.description: Initial description, mapping and number of wounds that exist at the start of the wound care episode

concept.name: Wound Classification
concept.implamentationGuidance:
Wound type/classification: Surgical wounds should be classified by the amount of contamination which could lead to delayed wound healing and infection: Clean, Clean-Contaminated, Contaminated, Dirty

<225552003 |Wound finding (finding)|
concept.description:
Wounds should be classified by the dominant cause of wounding and/ or non-healing e.g. diabetic foot ulcer, venous leg ulcer, pressure ulcer etc,

Surgical wounds should be classified by the amount of contamination which could lead to delayed wound healing and infection:

Clean, Clean-Contaminated, Contaminated, Dirty <225552003 |Wound finding (finding)|

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for the wound classification

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Problem list
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This section allows for all relevant diagnoses, symptoms, conditions, problems, and issues relating to the cause or diagnosis of the wound.


When a diagnosis has not yet been made, the most granular clinical concept with the highest level of certainty should be displayed. This may be a problem, symptom, sign, or test result, and may evolve over time, as a conventional diagnosis is reached. 

In some situations, a confirmed diagnosis may need to be qualified by a number of attributes to give further detail (e.g. severity, distribution (body site), laterality, or stage of disease etc.   ‘Onset date’ should be included where available even if this is estimated in source systems. 


It is essential that where a diagnosis is unconfirmed (e.g. suspected, disputed, or excluded) that this is not misinterpreted or coded as a confirmed diagnosis.

In a problem list there should be only one entry for each occurrence of a problem. Thus for chronic problems such as diabetes, there should only ever be one entry. Acute problems such as heart attacks may occur multiple times in the problem list, but each entry should represent a separate clinical event and not merely a new consultation relating to that event. All a person's problems should be visible in the diabetes record.

Problem list relates solely to the wound diagnosis (aetiology), the list of potential codes will need to be extensive for each category of wound.

  • EPUAP (European pressure ulcer advisory panel) grade 1 ulcer <<376951000000105 |European pressure ulcer advisory panel grade 1 ulcer (disorder)|

  • EPUAP (European pressure ulcer advisory panel) grade 2 ulcer <<376961000000108 |European pressure ulcer advisory panel grade 2 ulcer (disorder)|

  • EPUAP (European pressure ulcer advisory panel) grade 3 ulcer. <<376971000000101 |European pressure ulcer advisory panel grade 3 ulcer (disorder)|

  • EPUAP (European pressure ulcer advisory panel) grade 4 ulcer <<376981000000104 |European pressure ulcer advisory panel grade 4 ulcer (disorder)|

  • EPUAP (European pressure ulcer advisory panel unstageable / unclassified

  • Fungating lesion 945811000000102 |Fungating wound (finding)|

  • Moisture lesion

  • Leg ulcer <<95344007 |Ulcer of lower extremity (disorder)|

  • Abscess of skin <<31928004 |Abscess of skin and/or subcutaneous tissue (disorder)|

  • Wound dehiscence <<225553008 |Wound dehiscence (disorder)|

  • Pilonidal sinus <<238496008 |Hair sinus (disorder)|

  • Laceration <<312608009 |Laceration - injury (disorder)|

  • Burn <<125666000 |Burn (disorder)|

  • Surgical wound 945791000000103 |Surgical wound (disorder)|

  • Wound Not specified <417163006 |Traumatic or non-traumatic injury (disorder)|

  • Venous ulcer of leg <<402863005 |Venous stasis ulcer of leg (disorder)| or |Ulcer of limb due to chronic venous insufficiency (disorder)|

  • Complex venous leg ulcer 1066131000000106 |Complex venous leg ulcer (disorder)|Mixed arteriovenous leg ulcer

  • Simple venous leg ulcer 1066121000000109 |Simple venous leg ulcer (disorder)|

  • Arterial lower limb ulcer 872381000000101 |Arterial lower limb ulcer (disorder)|

  • Diabetic foot ulcer​ <<371087003 |Ulcer of foot due to diabetes mellitus (disorder)|

  • Foot ulcer non diabetic <<95345008 |Ulcer of foot (disorder)| MINUS <<371087003 |Ulcer of foot due to diabetes mellitus (disorder)|

    Further guidance on the use of problem lists in systems can be found in PRSB's diagnosis recording guidance (see https://theprsb.org/standards/diagnosesrecording/).
concept.description: A summary of the problems that require investigation or treatment.

concept.description:
This is a problem list record entry.  <br clear="none"/> 
                         <br clear="none"/> There may be 0 to many record entries under problem list.  <br clear="none"/> 
                         <br clear="none"/> Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Problem
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This section allows for relevant diagnosis of the wound cause (or for free text if it cannot be coded)

When a diagnosis has not yet been made, the most granular clinical concept with the highest level of certainty should be displayed. This may be a problem, symptom, sign, or test result, and may evolve over time, as a conventional diagnosis is reached.

In some situations, a confirmed diagnosis may need to be qualified by a number of attributes to give further detail (e.g. severity, distribution (body site), laterality, or stage of disease etc.

It is essential that where a diagnosis is unconfirmed (e.g. suspected, disputed, or excluded) that this is not misinterpreted or coded as a confirmed diagnosis.

Further guidance on the use of problem lists in systems can be found in PRSB's diagnosis recording guidance (see https://theprsb.org/standards/diagnosesrecording/).
concept.description:
A condition which needs addressing and so is important for every professional to know about when seeing the person.  <br clear="none"/> 
                             <br clear="none"/> Problems may include diagnoses, symptoms, and social or behavioural issues

concept.name: Problem status
concept.implamentationGuidance: Problems and issues may be active (currently relevant to care or under active healthcare management; prominent in the record) or inactive - healed (past conditions or those which do not currently require active healthcare management; less prominent in the record).
concept.description: The status of the problem. This can be either active or inactive.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.implamentationGuidance:
The problem status of the problem should be coded using only one SNOMED CT concept that is a subtype of the following code:

 

SNOMED CT ID  │  Fully specified name (FSN)  │  Implementation guidance

 

394731006 │ Problem statuses (qualifier value) │ Descendant of concept.

Where required codes are unavailable the free text field should be used and consideration given to the submission of a new code request to UK SNOMED CT request submission portal (see https://isd.digital.nhs.uk/rsp/user/guest/home.jsf). Contact info@thePRSB.org for further information.


Further guidance on the use of problem lists in systems can be found in PRSB's diagnosis recording guidance (see https://theprsb.org/standards/diagnosesrecording/).

Value domain typeCode
concept.description: The coded value for problem status.

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Problem priority
concept.implamentationGuidance:
Some systems provide the ability to categorise problems as ‘major’ ('significant' in this standard) or ‘minor’, or assign a priority number. ‘Minor’ problems may automatically become inactive after a period of time. The use of these classifications is not currently standardised, so it should not be relied upon to identify all serious conditions.

Further guidance on the use of problem lists in systems can be found in PRSB's diagnosis recording guidance (see https://theprsb.org/standards/diagnosesrecording/).
concept.description: The problem priority level. This can be either significant or minor.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.implamentationGuidance:
The problem status of the problem should be coded using only one SNOMED CT concept from the following value set:

 

SNOMED CT ID  │  Fully specified name (FSN)  │  Implementation guidance

 

386134007 │ Significant (qualifier value) │ Equal of concept.
255606000 │ Minor (qualifier value) │ Equal of concept. 

 

Where required codes are unavailable the free text field should be used and consideration given to the submission of a new code request to UK SNOMED CT request submission portal (see https://isd.digital.nhs.uk/rsp/user/guest/home.jsf). Contact info@thePRSB.org for further information.


Further guidance on the use of problem lists in systems can be found in PRSB's diagnosis recording guidance (see https://theprsb.org/standards/diagnosesrecording/).

Value domain typeCode
concept.description: The coded value for problem priority.

concept.name: Contacts with professionals
concept.implamentationGuidance: This section includes the details of the person’s contacts with services, their encounters. This information may need to be filtered to only display what is relevant for a particular use case and professional’s discipline. This includes outpatient appointments, home visits, hospital and outpatient attendances, out of hours GP visits, clinic appointments, social worker visits etc.

concept.name: Wound assessment
concept.implamentationGuidance: This section makes provision for all assessments, with the initial (primary) assessment identified
concept.description: Periodic assessments, both structured and unstructured, as recommended by best clinical practice (NWCSP)

concept.name: Initial (Primary) Wound Assessment
concept.implamentationGuidance: This is a flag to indicated whether or not the wound assessment is the primary (or initial) assessment of the wound, There should only be one primary assessment for each wound episode of care
concept.description: Boolean indicating whether (or not) this assessment is a initial (or primary) assessment

concept.name: Structured assessment
concept.implamentationGuidance: The structured assessment includes any assessment that is relevant to the patient / wound, it could include any NICE recommended assessment such as TIMES, SINBAD etc or a patient based assessment, such as a frailty assessment
concept.description: Details of the structured assessment.

concept.name: Structured assessment name
concept.implamentationGuidance:
The structured assessment data concept can be used to record a range of assessments applicable to wound care. The SNOMED CT terminology associated with wound care assessments is available on the PRSB website here [DN need to include a hyperlink to the document at this point]

The linked document includes terminology for the following assessments

  • Braden Scale

  • Norton Scale

  • NPUAP/AHCP R staging system

  • PEDIS Score for Diabetic Foot Ulcers

  • Pressure Ulcer Scale for Healing (PUSH)

  • PURPOSE-T

  • Rockwood frailty Score

  • SINBAD

  • TEXAS

  • Waterlow Scale

SNOMED CT terminology does not exist for the following assessment frameworks, these can be recorded using the text options in the information model. SNOMED CT terminology has been applied for and the reference document (and this guidance) will be updated once these terms have been released

  • Pressure Sore Status Tool (PSST)Sussman Wound Healing Tool

  • Therapeutic Index for Local Infection (TiLi)

  • TIME

  • TIME(S)

  • WiFi

  • Wound Healing Scale (WHS)
concept.description: Structured assessment name e.g. New York Heart Failure, Glasgow Coma scale, Activities of Daily Living (ADL) etc.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for structured assessment name.

Where the document is a KOS document this field (designated typeCode) is used to carry the DICOM Imaging procedure: This attribute shall be populated by the XDS-I Imaging Document Source from a code in the Procedure Code Sequence (0008,1032) of the performed procedure

concept.name: Ankle–brachial pressure index
concept.description:
The ankle-brachial pressure index (ABPI) or ankle-brachial index (ABI) is the ratio of the blood pressure at the ankle to the blood pressure in the upper arm(brachium). Compared to the arm, lower blood pressure in the leg suggests blocked arteries due to peripheral artery disease (PAD). The ABPI is calculated by dividing the systolic blood pressure at the ankle by the systolic blood pressure in the arm.[1]

  • Less than 0.5 suggests severe arterial disease.

    • Compression treatment is contraindicated. 

    • Refer the person urgently for specialist vascular assessment. 

  • Greater than 0.5 to less than 0.8 suggests the presence of arterial disease or mixed arterial/venous disease.

    • Compression should generally be avoided. However, reduced compression can be used under specialist advice and with strict supervision.

    • Refer the person for specialist vascular assessment. 

  • Between 0.8 and 1.3 suggests no evidence of significant arterial disease.

    • Compression may be safely applied in most people. 

    • For people with cardiac failure, consider seeking specialist advice as there may be a risk of fluid overload if not closely monitored. 

  • Greater than 1.3 may suggest the presence of arterial calcification, such as in some people with diabetes, rheumatoid arthritis, systemic vasculitis, atherosclerotic disease, and advanced chronic renal failure. For values above 1.5, the vessels are likely to be incompressible, and the result cannot be relied on to guide clinical decisions.

    • Care must be taken in interpreting ABPI results in people with these conditions, as they may be misleadingly high.

    • Compression therapy should be used with caution in people with diabetes, who may have unreliable ABPIs due to arterial calcification as well as an underlying sensory neuropathy.

    • Refer to a vascular service as further assessments may be required to determine the person's suitability for compression therapy.
concept.valueSets: Ratio of blood pressure at ankle : blood pressure in upper arm

concept.name: Toe pressure index
concept.description: Commonly used in patients with diabetes and peripheral arterial disease, a toe brachial pressure index (TBPI) is a noninvasive way of determining arterial perfusion in feet and toes. A Doppler device and a sphygmomanometer are used to measure systolic pressure in the arm and the great toe.
concept.valueSets: ratio between the systolic blood pressure in the right or left toe and the higher of the systolic pressure in the right or left arms.

Wounds that fit neatly together are referred to as “well approximated.” This is when the edges of a wound fit neatly together, such as a surgical incision, and can close easily.

concept.implamentationGuidance: 271776004 |Soft tissue crepitus (finding)|
concept.description:
Is crepitus present

crepitus describes a popping, clicking or crackling sound in a joint. Joint popping sounds – what some may call bone cracking – may mean that air is moving in the joint, which is usually harmless.
concept.valueSets: Yes / No indicating whether or not Crepitus is present

concept.name: Healing ridge present
concept.implamentationGuidance: <298005009 |Finding of wound healing (finding)|
concept.description:
Is there a healing ridge

A healing ridge of thickened tissue indicating newly formed collagen can be felt about 1cm either side of the incision along its length, and persists into the remodelling phase
concept.valueSets: Yes / No indicating the presence of a healing ridge

concept.name: Wound and skin care treatment
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This section allows for the recording of any wound treatments that the care professional delivers to the person. This includes:

  • the application of wound care products (dressings, lotions etc.),

  • the prescription of medications,

  • any procedures undertaken, such as debridement

  • any therapies provided

  • requests for investigations

  • details of referrals to other services

  • advice and guidance given

concept.description: The technique or method by which the medication is to be administered.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for method
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - ^999000041000001103 | ePrescribing method simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no coded text available

concept.name: Supply type
concept.description: A description of the type of supply (e.g. emergency supply, over the counter medication, patient group direction etc)

concept.name: Batch number
concept.description: The batch number of the product.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for the batch number
concept.valueSets: FMD code : - Derived from Falsified medicines directive

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Additional instructions
concept.description: Allows for: requirements for adherence support, e.g. compliance aids, prompts and packaging requirements, additional information about specific medicines e.g. where specific brand required, person requirements, e.g. unable to swallow tablets.
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set : - Additional instruction

concept.name: Request for advice
concept.description: Request for advice and recommendation about medication

concept.name: Matters identified during discussion
concept.description: Matters identified during the service about the patient's experience of using the medication.
concept.valueSets:
Coded text using the following descriptors:
a. patient reports using the medicine as prescribed
b. patient reports not using the medicine as prescribed
c. patient has not started using the medicine
d. prescriber has stopped new medicine
e. patient is not using the medicine in line with the directions of the prescriber
f. patient reports missing a dose in the past 7 days
g. patient reports need for more information about the medicine
h. patient reports side effects
i. patient reports negative feelings about the medicine
j. patient reports uncertainty on whether the medicine is working
k. patient reports concern about remembering to take the medicine
l. patient reports difficulty using the medicine due to its pharmaceutical form/formulation
i. other - free text option

concept.name: Medical devices entry
concept.implamentationGuidance: Off loading devices
concept.description: Medical devices

concept.name: Medical device
concept.description: Details of a medical device used by the person.

concept.name: Device type
concept.description: The device type.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for device type.

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available.

concept.name: Device manufacturer
concept.description: Name of the device manufacturer.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for device manufacturer.

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Model
concept.description: The model of the device.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for model.

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Comments
concept.description: Any information regarding the medical device.

concept.name: Procedures and therapies
concept.description: The details of any procedures performed. Includes both psychological and medical therapies and procedures (e.g. cognitive behaviour therapy, hip replacement)

concept.name: Procedure record entry
concept.description: This is a procedure record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Procedure
concept.description: The therapeutic or diagnostic procedure performed. Includes both psychological and medical therapies and procedures (e.g. cognitive behaviour therapy, or follow-up interventions as a result of physical health checks). Complementary or alternative procedures and therapies should be recorded here.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The procedure code.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - <71388002 |Procedure| OR <129125009 |Procedure with explicit context|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Anatomical site
concept.description: The body site of the procedure

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value of the anatomical site.

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Laterality
concept.description: Laterality of the procedure

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for laterality.

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Complications related to procedure
concept.description: Details of any intra-operative complications encountered during the procedure, arising during the person’s stay in the recovery unit or directly attributable to the procedure.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for complications relating to procedure.

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Information and advice given
concept.description: Information and advice given.

concept.name: Information and advice given
concept.description: The oral, written, or multi-media information or advice given to the person, carer, other authorised representative, care professional or other third party. May include advice about actions related to medicines or other ongoing care activities on an ‘information prescription'. State here if there are concerns about the extent to which the person and/or carer understand the information provided about diagnosis, prognosis and treatment.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for information and advice given.

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Plan and requested actions
concept.description: The details of planned investigations, procedures and treatment, and whether this plan has been agreed with the person or their legitimate representative.

concept.name: Plan and requested actions record entry
concept.description: This is a plan and requested actions record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Actions for professionals
concept.description:
Including planned investigations, procedures and treatment for a person's identified conditions and priorities. For each action the following should be identified:outcome expectations, including the person’s expectations. A record of the planned and requested actions. May be structured (table), with actions, names, dates, status, location,
                            strategies.

concept.name: Actions for person or their carer
concept.description: For each action the following should be identified:outcome expectations, including person’s expectations. A record of the planned and requested actions. May be structured (table), with actions, names, dates, status, location, strategies.

concept.name: Agreed with the person or their legitimate representative
concept.description: Indicates whether the person or their legitimate representative has agreed the entire plan or individual aspects of treatment, expected outcomes, risks and alternative treatments. A record of the agreement of the decisions made.

concept.name: Future appointments
concept.description: Details of future appointments.

concept.name: Future appointments record entry
concept.description: This is the future appointments record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Date of appointment
concept.description: Date and time of future appointment.

concept.name: Appointment status
concept.description: The status of the appointment e.g. proposed, booked, confirmed, rejected.

concept.name: Reason for appointment
concept.description: Reason this appointment is scheduled e.g. diagnosis, investigation, treatment or assessment

concept.name: Clinical urgency of appointment
concept.description: Urgency of appointment.

concept.name: Location of future appointment
concept.description: The location of the appointment.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for location
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Organisation data service

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Specialty
concept.description: The specialty e.g. physiotherapy, oncology, mental health etc.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Activity treatment function code

concept.name: Service
concept.description: The service that was provided

concept.name: Coded Value
concept.description: The code for service provided
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT :- ^1127531000000102 |Services simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Professional to see the person
concept.description: The name and role of the professional e.g. consultant, care worker, nurse consultant.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the professional seeing the person.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The role of the professional seeing the person.
concept.valueSets: FHIR values set : -  ukcorepractitionerrolecode

concept.name: Consent
concept.description: Legal information captured relating to patient care, such as consent.

concept.name: Consent relating to child
concept.description: Consideration of age and competency, applying Gillick competency or Fraser guidelines. Record of person with parental responsibility or appointed guardian where child lacks competency. Record if there is disagreement between patient and parent.

concept.name: Consent for treatment record
concept.description: Whether consent has been obtained for the treatment. May include where record of consent is located or record of consent.

concept.name: Deviation from plan
concept.description: Rationale for variation from the plan

concept.name: Wound care episode outcome
concept.implamentationGuidance: The wound care outcome section allows the recording of the outcome of the wound care episode, this could be a healed wound, but could be when no further treatment is being delivered
concept.description: Recorded outcome of the wound care episode, based on the existing clinical summary data concept

concept.name: Wound Healed
concept.implamentationGuidance: <298005009 |Finding of wound healing (finding)|
concept.description: Defined as either wound remains open upon removal of closure method or full epithelialisation across 100% of wound bed

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value of the wound healed

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Wound Healed Date
concept.description: The date that the wound was assessed as being healed

concept.name: Episode summary
concept.description: Summary of the episode or period of care. Where possible, very brief. This may include interpretation of findings and results; differential diagnoses, opinion and specific action(s). Planned actions should be recorded under plan and requested actions or in the personalised care and support plan.
